reviews.review: I loved the first two Bioshock games, but this is by far better. People can play this who haven't played the first two and still enjoy it, as it is totally different. But the concept is the same. It's steam punk meets 20's-30's meets advance technology sprinkled with a bit of techno magic. The story line is enticing as well. Loved it! I think anyone who plays this will love it too.

Que jogo. Meu amigo, que jogo. Para mim, é uns dos melhores jogos que eu joguei na minha vida e um dos poucos a me fazer ficar apaixonado por tudo. A jogabilidade é digamos que sua caixa de brinquedos, ela é só uma justificativa para a história de BioShock Infinite mas, ainda assim, é incrivel. A trilha sonora, a arte desse jogo é sensacional. E que história. Ela é complexa, pode deixar confuso, mas procure um pouco a mais na internet, não vais se arrepender. Sem palavras, 99 vidas com 5 estrelas de bônus, vale muitíssimo a pena, e comprem Burial at Sea Part 1 e 2, antes joguem todos os Bioshocks. Enfim, Bioshock Infinite.

Story rich and everything is in amazing detail, graphics are amazing and even can run smoothly (on medium settings lol)  on shittier low ended graphics cards. But be wary of it's massive file size if you are limited in hard drive space. 

10/10. worth playing the campaign multiple times (if you have all the time in the world because the campaign takes 5ever to complete).

Bioshock infinite. Without a doubt, one of the most intelligent, thought-provoking, thrill inducing, tear-jerking, mind-blowing game of recent times. 
The story of Bioshock Infinite is the best written, most spectacularly executed and refreshingly original I have come across in an extremely long time as a gamer. Every time the plot throws an huge twist at you, you think "Surely nothing could top that, surely it can't get better..." and then it does. 
Every main character is expertly written and has motivations which may not be easy to comprehend, but when you realise them, you have to appreciate the depth and time that has been put into them. Keep an eye out for a certain character named Lutece....I won't give any spoilers but they are not quite what they appear to be, yet provide more genuine comedic moments than most other games.

The soundtrack is excellent, following the Bioshock tradition of taking tunes and styles we know and twisting them so they are just recognisable but still create atmosphere.
The gameplay is consistent with the Bioshock series, with the added factor of Skyhook combat; it can feel a little clunky and basic at times but the sheer fun, speed and immersion make you forget it completely. 

The attention to detail is superb, particularly with the collectible audio logs, giving both mundane and plot-important info, but all of them are worth finding and hearing! Here and there you'll find an audio log, or a note, or overhear some NPCs talking and you'll find a joke so funny you giggle to yourself while you play.

All in all, Infinite is an ambitiously aimed and grandly accomplished game, definitely worth playing no matter what your preferred genre is (FPS, shoot em up, RPG, story-driven, steampunkish, it's got the lot). 
It's on sale now. Do yourself a favour, spend a little money, and fall in love with a whole lot of game.

今までやってきたシングルプレイゲームの中で最高傑作です。
ストーリーがとても凝っていて、ストーリーを進めたいがために、時間を忘れて夢中でプレイしました。
プレイ初めはディズニーランドに紛れ込んだような感覚でしたが、そこから一気にシリアスな展開へと変わっていき、もうプレイを止めることが出来ませんでした。
ここから個人的なレビューになりますが、総評として是非他の人にお勧めしたいゲームです。
まずとても良かった点からレビューしていきます。

・前作同様に、一つの世界が完成されている。住人の会話や、建物の細かい造形から、この世界の文化や規律、そして政治的なところまで細かく読み取れる。
・エリザベスというヒロインが常にプレイヤーと行動する。ストーリーと密接に関わってくるのは言うまでありませんが、ＮＰＣとしてここまで豪華にするのかと思うぐらいアニメーションから全て丁寧に作られています。エリザベス自身とても魅力的な存在ですが、ゲームをプレイしていくのに比例してどんどん魅力的な存在になっていきます。
・上に記した通り素晴らしいストーリー。とても明るいコロンビアの町から物語はスタートし、こんなエンディングで終わるとは、、、

次に残念だった点をレビューします。

・中盤以降、戦闘がストーリーを進めるためのミニゲームになってしまう。武器は一部かぶる性能のものがあり、もっと個性的なコロンビアにしかない武器を出せば面白かったと思う。
戦闘は特に戦略性がなく、特殊能力の存在を忘れてしまうほど単調。特殊能力を使いましょうというヒントが表示され思い出しました。
どのゲームにもいえることですが、世界観にあいまって、最初はどんな単調な戦闘でも面白いものです。
もう少し戦闘が面白ければ、個人的には完璧なゲームでした。

ＦＰＳよりはアクションRPGといった方がよいかもしれません。
ばりばりＦＰＳやりたいという人にはあまりお勧めできませんが、セール中なので是非プレイしてみて下さい。
プレイ後、すげーなこのゲームと思うはずです。５年間かけて製作されたこのゲームを「すげーな」の一言で終わらせてしまうのには惜しいくらいスタッフの愛を感じたゲームでした。わりとマジで。
역대 유래가 없을 정도로 훌륭한 스토리, 독특하고 매력적인 세계관이 훌륭하다. 거기에 전투의 타격감과 박진감도 부족함이 없다. 완벽한 게임.

Believe the hype... the combat is occassionally repetitive and the story a bit too linear compared to the sandbox style we're all used to these days, but the level design, artwork and soundtrack are superb - and you can play it how you want, there's no sure-fire way to win  a level.

Nutshell: Lopsided and ambitious storytelling pays off, but only in some areas

The gameplay may be fantastic (and almost constantly is), but you come to a BioShock game for the story. Without going to far into spoilers, the story introduces jaw dropping set pieces and arguably better characters than the original BioShock. The problem is, almost no focus is given to these characters in favor of a larger story that wastes its time setting up then throwing a hot mess of plot at you in the last 15 minutes of the game. Even the main antagonist is fleshed out barely enough until the very end, giving you little reason to desire to stop him throughout the 12-15 hr campaign. Elizabeth alone is worth the reccomendation but the jury is out on the rest of the storyline. You will either love it for its mind blowing end or hate it for leaving too many loose ends.

Truly a masterpiece of modern game-dev.
Every aspect of this game is Super Rich!
The plot, the world, the gameplay, everything looks and feels like it was polished for ages.
10 out of 10, and i don't even know another game that gets a 10 in my top list.
The Graphics and Gameplay is unbelievable! This game is real quality.

I honestly wish steam reviews were more than a thumbs up or down, as I know most games are more than just "good" or "bad" and this is one of them.

That said, the atmosphere and graphics are still just as great as the first. The controls play smoothly, and a decent amount of the fights are fun.

Unfortunately, Infinite is a dumbed down shoot em up version of the games that gave it it's name. It felt more like I was playing a call of duty campaign, not the gritty tactical masterpiece that was the first Bioshock. It was a very linear experience unlike the first Bioshock. In infinite you follow the path the game has laid out for you, you fight a horde of enemies, and you move onto the next area. There's very little room for variety or experementation like in games such as Bioshock 1 or Dishonored. 

Overall I'd rate the game a 7/10. It's a decent game, and certainly worth a playthrough but I'd recommend you should definitely only buy it if it's on sale if you want to get your money's worth.

Fantastic shooter. Amazing environments, atmosphere, story and a complex, rich and challenging ending. A must-play.

[h1]Bioshock Infinite Review[/h1]

[b]GAMEPLAY[/b]

+ Engaging, fun combat and utilization of FPS mechanics
+ Addition of skylines, allowing you to perform aerial executions, as well as reaching vantage points
+ A variety of Vigor powers, which are upgradeable
+ Clever use of placeable covers, vantage points, ammo stocks and medical supplies across the battlefield.
+ Varietized enemies
+ Great enviromental interaction

- Small amount of weapons
- Only 2 weapons can be carried at once
- Combat gets repetetive at points
- Impractical gear
- Side quests are dull and involve a lot of backtracking

[b]STORY[/b]

+ Great characters
+ Good introduction to place and time
+ Well written backstory
+ Elizabeth is briliantly acted
+ Jaw dropping plot twist and ending

- Stretched middle section.

[b]GRAPHICS[/b]

+ Wonderfully designed City of Columbia
+ Beautiful, vivid colours outside
+ Extremely atmospheric and immersive
+ Beautiful enviroments (One of the best ever)

- Had problems involving wierd texture streaming, however easily fixed

[b]VERDICT[/b]

Bioshock is an absolutely astonishing game, which looks beautiful and has an amazing story and characters. Combat and gumplay is fun and engaging, keeping you glued to your screen for the hours the main story lasts. A must have for any gamer, especially FPS and Story Rich game fans. Go buy it now!

[b]9.6/10[/b]

With the core game done and all the DLC (Seriously - Fuck Clash in the Clouds), all 80 achievements have been downed.

So I guess its time to open up my opinion on the core game. Its story just HAS to be its selling point as it is one of the best stories ever conceived in gaming history... HOWEVER... that doesn't go to say that it is perfect. The game has a habit of leaving gaping holes in the plot and escaped a lot of responsibility by making certain characters omniscient.

Gameplay wise, pretty average. A mix between gunplay and vigors makes for a mildly interesting combat experience. If you play games for pure gameplay and not story - Bioshock probably is not for you.

For the DLC... Clash in the Clouds is entirely combat oriented. Because it focuses on the weakest part of the game - the gameplay (Weird, huh?) - the DLC sucks as a result.

Burial at Sea Episode one has terrible gameplay but a fantastic ending... While the second episode has amazing gameplay (Stealth is fun) but the story seems contrived at times.

Overall... Well worth the experience if just for the story (So long as you can overlook a few plot holes). But I would not buy this game on gameplay alone. If you can, pick up both Burial at Sea episodes, but feel free to skip Clash in the Clouds.

Never played the previous games, but there is enough twists to get you hooked with the story. The gameplay mechanics are nice and smooth, complementing the amazing story. The controls are not hard to get used to, but not too easy either. If you're into FPS then this game shouldn't be too hard. I love how they could create a beautiful balance between the gameplay and the story. I mean if you somehow get frustrated with the controls, which is unlikely at least for me, the story will always keep you going. As I've never played the previous games in the series, I really shouldn't say whether you should or should not play them first. However, that didn't affect my experience with this game at all. For me, this is one of the best games I've ever played, if not the best.

- Amazing story
- Smooth gameplay mechanics
- Stunning visual
- If you're into FPS then this game shouldn't be too hard
- If you're NOT into FPS, at least stay for the story and visuals, you WON'T be disappointed
- 10/10

Eh, it's okay. It's a hallway shooter. Don't expect much else. The ending is like a convoluted version of the Donnie Darko plot, except everything is spelled out five times. There are a few really decent segments, but for the most part, the game requires you not to think about the story and just go ahead and shoot the things that are in your way. The world also lacks life from the first hour or so on. 
The reason I don't recommend this is that both of the first two Bioshock games are superior - you got a feeling for the place you were in, you could follow the plot at every point and there were no unfair enemies with Mega Man-like boss weaknesses (try using the Raven power against Handymen and you'll see what I mean).
The story is excellent, the gameplay not so much, sometimes the arena fights are tedious and way too easy and just get in the way of the story.
